fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e2.equipments.solar_panel.mil

Class StochasticSunIntensityModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e2.equipments.solar_panel.mil.StochasticSunIntensityModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SunIntensityModelI, SunStateManagementI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExternalEvents(imported={SunriseEvent.class,SunsetEvent.class})
 @ModelExportedVariable(name="sunIntensityCoef",
                       type=java.lang.Double.class)
public class StochasticSunIntensityModel
extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
implements SunIntensityModelI
    The class StochasticSunIntensityModel implements the simulation model that computes the intensity of the sun, including the cloud transparency using stochastic parameters.

    Description

    This simulation model provides a solar intensity in the form of a performance coefficient aggregating the azimuth of the sun compared to the orientation of the solar panel and the altitude of the sun compared to the slope of the solar panel. Azimuth angles are expressed north-based; this is the direction along the horizon, measured from north to east (or example, 0.0 means north, 135.0 means southeast, 270.0 means west.

    This model also introduces the effect of clouds on the sun intensity by applying a random coefficient in [0, 1]. This is not a very good stochastic model for sun intensity as there is no correlation between successive random coefficients. In the real world, large clouds induces long period of low intensity.

    • Imported events: SunriseEvent, SunsetEvent
    • Exported events: none
    • Imported variables: none
    • Exported variables: name = sunIntensityCoef, type = Double

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2025-10-06

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Detail

      • StochasticSunIntensityModel

        public StochasticSunIntensityModel(java.lang.String uri,
                                   java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                                   fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces.AtomicSimulatorI simulationEngine)
        create an atomic hybrid input/output model with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator using the given time unit for its clock.

        Contract

         pre     uri == null || !uri.isEmpty()
 pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine != null && !simulationEngine.isModelSet()
 pre     simulationEngine instanceof AtomicEngine
 post    !isDebugModeOn()
 post    getURI() != null && !getURI().isEmpty()
 post    uri == null || getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation clock.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine enacting the model.
